Dutch[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Related to krenken (“to hurt”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • Audio
    		(file)

Adjective[edit]

krank (comparative kranker, superlative krankst)

  1. (archaic) sick, ill
    Synonym: ziek

Inflection[edit]

Inflection of krank
uninflectedkrank
inflectedkranke
comparativekranker
positivecomparativesuperlative
predicative/adverbialkrankkrankerhet krankst
het krankste
indefinitem./f. sing.krankekrankerekrankste
n. sing.krankkrankerkrankste
pluralkrankekrankerekrankste
definitekrankekrankerekrankste
partitivekrankskrankers—

Antonyms[edit]

  • gezond
  • genezen

Derived terms[edit]

  • krankzinnig, krankenhuis

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German krank, from Old High German *krank, from Proto-Germanic *krangaz, *krankaz (“crooked, weak”). Akin to English crank.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /kʁaŋk/
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -aŋk

Adjective[edit]

krank (comparative kränker, superlative am kränksten)

  1. sick; ill
  2. (slang) excellent

Hunsrik[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German krank, from Old High German *krank, from Proto-Germanic *krangaz, *krankaz (“crooked, weak”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /kraŋk/

Adjective[edit]

krank (comparative krenker, superlative krenkest)

  1. ill, sick
    Sie sin krank.
    They are sick.
    Die kranke Leit sin im Hospital.
    The sick people are in the hospital.
    Unser Hund is krank.
    Our dog is sick.

Declension[edit]

Declension of krank
masculinefeminineneuterplural
Weak inflectionnominativekrankkrankkrankkranke
accusativekrankekrankkrankkranke
dativekrankekrankekrankekranke
Strong inflectionnominativekrankerkrankekrankeskranke
accusativekrankekrankekrankeskranke
dativekrankemkrankerkrankemkranke

Antonyms[edit]

  • gesund

Derived terms[edit]

  • Krankheet f
  • Krankheit f

Further reading[edit]

  • Online Hunsrik Dictionary

Luxembourgish[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German kranc.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /kʀɑŋk/
    • Rhymes: -ɑŋk

Adjective[edit]

krank (masculine kranken, neuter krankt, comparative méi krank, superlative am kranksten)

  1. ill, sick

Declension[edit]

krank

  1. ill, sick
